reviews.review_msg: Josh is a kind and caring professor. His lecture slides are a condensed version of the textbook, so it's important to take good notes when he speaks to make sure you don't miss any information. His tutorial material is very helpful and I like the amount of practice exams he provides. His exams are open book, but there are trick questions.

Josh gives a lot of practice material for all his exams and is extremely responsive to emails and great at explaining concepts if you go to his office hours. His exams are tricky and sometimes contains trick questions, and you would need to study for them just as much you would study for a closed book exam, relying on open book won't get you an A.

You don't need the textbook. Take good notes. 2 mid-terms and a Final. All open book (doesn't help much). 

Understand the concepts, attend lectures and tutorials and you'll do fine. Make sure you study, don't rely on your notes.
If you do better on the Final he will cross off a mid term so that is a big plus.

Professor himself is a great dude.

Would give this man a 10 if i could! probably one of the most caring profs at SFU. very thorough and it is very clear he enjoys teaching students. I love how he asks for feedback about his teaching in his survey because most profs would not care. His exams are very straight forward but some questions have you thinking out of the box. Good man.

Josh is a chill professor and really enthusiastic about the material. Exams were open book but pretty difficult, so make sure to study for them like you would for a normal exam. Sometimes he throws in a few trick questions as well. He gave lots of study questions and posted the answer key after the exam.

Josh was a great instructor who clearly wanted everyone to pass and offered plenty of opportunities to boost your grade. Lectures were easy to understand for someone who isn't usually number-savvy. Exams were tricky but nothing crazy as long as you made an effort to engage with the material. Josh is easy to talk to and was always happy to help.

Professor Boitnott was one of the best professors I have had. His lectures were super engaging and makes the content interesting. He was really enthusiastic and cared about his students. Exams were open book, so they were not too difficult. Gave lots of study questions and posted the answer key after the exam. Would 100% recommend courses with him!

josh is a great prof and one of my favourites. he's very funny and makes lectures interesting with interactive games sometimes. every exam was open book too and there were weekly quizzes which weren't bad. he did surveys for partic. marks to see how his teaching was which i loved. accessible out of class too. didn't even use  textbook once though
Such an amazing professor!! My all time favourite prof,  he makes Econ interesting, and engaging (he's also hilarious)

Definitely recommend his class. I barely had to study and did extremely well. His explanations are excellent, so just listen in lectures and you will do well. He seems very passionate about what he is talking about.

Pierre is an awesome prof to take 113 with. He genuinely cares about his students' learning, and provides more than enough resources for us to do well, including practice exams, tutorial q's, guides, hints, and tips. Lectures are good, he's overall a great guy. Exams were straightforward and directly reflected material from the FREE textbook/slides

Pierre was a very chill prof. I appreciated that the course material wasn't too heavy in content, and all his lectures really made sense to me. At times I got confused but if you pay attention, you should be good. He uses things like visuals and gives breaks throughout class. He really tries to make sure you're understanding the concepts too.
Easy course but a horribly rude and dismissive professor that does not wish for the best for students. TA's provide unclear and useless tutorials that are mandatory
Extremely rude professor not professional at all

The class was well structured and not confusing, and how Pierre explained the concepts helped me understand everything well. The midterm and final were very manageable and were based exactly on things from the lectures so they were not difficult to study for. He gave out a mock midterm and final which helped so much to study, I recommend this class

Pierre is a great professor who really cared about the students success. His lectures were done well, he's approachable and the textbook used was easy to read. The slides covered everything you need to know so the textbook was more supplemental. The tutorials and practice exams reflected the tests well.

Pierre is a decent prof. Overall, the class was easy for the most part. I didn't much read the textbook, I just studied the lecture slides and did the practice questions over and over again. Pierre was also very accessible around exam times. As long as you study, you will get a good grade.
Explains concepts very well! Pierre clearly cares about his students performing good.

BEST PROF AT SFU! If you're planning on taking 113 you should 100% take it with Mouganie, he's very good at explaining topics and provides good examples in class to help prepare for the exams. The textbook and practise exams were very helpful for the mid term and final! Overall, the course was really easy with Mouganie I wish he taught more classes

He was a great prof, I didn't attend the lectures very often and left half way when I did. Lectures are great, but the slides are enough. Textbook is free and provided online by prof and optional, never read it once. Slides, tutorial questions, and the mock exams are way more than enough to pass the class. Focus on practical, theory is not tested.

He makes a lot of extra effort to help you comprehend everything. His lectures are very organised and he teaches in a very clear way. During and before exams, he makes his expectations incredibly clear and tells you what exactly to study for. Overall he's a very nice guy, while his exams are hard, they're designed to apply knowledge not repeating.

Course was generally easy but the final exam was difficult for everyone. The questions were vague and worth a lot. Apart from that, his lectures were well-delivered and there were classes set aside for review.

I loved his lectures and found him really helpful during office hours, however the grade distribution and the way exams are formatted is what brought me down. The course content is super easy but it seems like the questions on exams were made through chat gpt. Really unclear and confusing. Read textbook, attend lectures, ask questions!!

His lectures were fine, but that final was so poorly made. It was worth 50% of our grade and he made it 100 minutes long. Each mcq question was worth 1.75% of our final grade which is ridiculous. His questions and answers were so vague. He just sucks at making tests
Pierre is a really great guy. Great lectures.He does a great job explaining the concepts and is willing to answer your questions. Take this class if you can. You will learn a lot!

prof is nice and you can ask him questions as many times as you want. make sure to go before midterm and final for review and make sure you understand the concept well or know why this is the right answer. Midterm and final was not that hard. But the average is really high and this class is curved.

As long as you attend tutorials, understand all the concepts and do all the tutorial questions you should do well in this class. The averages for the midterm and final were quite high as the tests are a good reflection of what we learn in this class.

90% of the grade is determined by the midterm and final. 10% is tutorial which i highly recommend going to because the class average for the tests tends to be quite high so the scale can really mess with your grade and having that extra 10% boost can really help. Overall the tests are a reflection of the lectures.

Pierre is a nice guy who deeply cares for his students. He explains topics exceptionally well, using intuitive examples during lectures. Exams are standard, drawn from lecture and tutorial classes. Time management is important for multiple-choice questions. The TA played a vital role and was incredibly supportive and available during office hours.

While Pierre is a nice enough guy, his TA's are horrible. The course is study based and the work is mostly from the slides and textbook. Tests make up a huge percentage of your grade so be prepared before taking them. Tutorials are pointless and TA's provide little help and are often late. lectures are boring but necessary.

Midterm and Final exam account for most of your grade. Lecture slides reflect what is in textbooks and it is possible to study the slides only and still be successful. Lectures are very informational and not a waste of time. Fair exams and good TA's. Initial readings are long but taper off and become more manageable towards the end of the class.

Very knowledgable professor, highly recommend if you're taking an economics class at SFU. Lectures are tough to pay attention the full way through, but he understands the subjects very well off the top of his head. Midterms and finals cover exactly what was went through the weekly lectures.

Pierre is an amazing, caring, and punctual professor. His textbook is online and free. Lectures are clear and he ensures students understand and don't fall behind. Textbook readings are optional but are recommended if you do not understand lecture content. Midterms are fair- no trick questions or uncovered material. Excellent TA's for the course.

Pierre is a great prof. Very understanding and treats the students with care. His lectures are boring at times but are useful. There are no tricks in his tests, they are about exactly what he taught us in lectures.

Pierre is a great lecturer, his lectures aren't too entertaining and based on readings but the class is extraordinarily easy, he is available for office hours, the tests are exactly what he teaches, and the textbook is free. Great guy, easy A.
